peripheral.title: ADC
peripheral.help_text:
An Analog to digital converter is a feature that converts an analog
voltage on a pin to a digital number. By converting from the analog
world to the digital world.

peripheral.title: ADC 12-bits
peripheral.help_text:
The 12-bit analog to digital converter has several external and two internal (temperature sensor,
voltage reference measurement) channels and performs conversions in single-shot or scan modes.

peripheral.title: ADC 12-bits
peripheral.help_text:
The 12-bit analog to digital converter,has up to 20 multiplexed channels.
A/D conversion of the various channels can be performed in Single, Continuous, Scan or Discontinuous mode.
The result of the ADC is stored in a left-aligned or right-aligned 16-bit data register.

The 12-bit analog to digital converter has several external and two internal (temperature sensor,

peripheral.title: ADC 14-bits
peripheral.help_text:
The 14-bit analog to digital converter has several external and three internals (temperature sensor,
voltage reference measurement and VBAT/4) channels and performs conversions in single-shot or scan modes.

The 14-bit analog to digital converter has several external and three internals (temperature sensor,
voltage reference measurement and VBAT/4) channels and performs conversions in single-shot or scan modes.

The 12-bit analog to digital converter has several external and five internal (temperature sensor,
voltage reference measurement,Vcore,Vbat and Connection to 2 DAC internal channels ) channels and performs conversions in single-shot or scan modes.
